trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> objects.
Adds a **Property** tab of the specified type to the collection.
The **Property** tab is added to the collection with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope> value of `Global`.
The **Property** tab type to add to the grid.
Adds a **Property** tab of the specified type and with the specified scope to the collection.
The **Property** tab type to add to the grid.
One of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope"></xref> values.
Removes all the **Property** tabs of the specified scope from the collection.
This method clears the tabs of the specified scope or smaller.
The `tabScope` parameter must be the `Component` or `Document` value of <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope>.
The scope of the tabs to clear.
The assigned value of the tabScope parameter is less than the `Document` value of .
Gets the number of **Property** tabs in the collection.
The number of **Property** tabs in the collection.
Returns an enumeration of all the **Property** tabs in the collection.
This method creates an enumerator that contains a snapshot of the collection.
You can change the collection by changing the enumerator; however, multiple enumerators can simultaneously access the same collection.

Changing the collection, either directly or through another enumerator, can cause <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> or <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> to throw an exception.
Two enumerators created from the same collection at the same time can contain different snapshots.
Removing objects from the enumerator also removes them from the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabCollection"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> at the specified index.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> to return.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> at the specified index.
Removes the specified tab type from the collection.
Removing the tab from the collection removes it from the property grid.
The tab type to remove from the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based array that receives the copied items from the collection.
The first position in the specified array to receive copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` to indicate the list is synchronized; otherwise `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the underlying list.
